function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Changing the focus of environment and animals as sources of diseases towards salutogenic approaches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-domestic animals in urban areas impacting human and animal health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for green space quality in study design","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to assess individual factors due to lack of objective measurements","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of representation of studies from south america and africa in urban wildlife research","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited diversity of exposures and stimuli in mental health studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Concentration of urban wildlife research in europe and north america","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of green space quality assessment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited studies assessing multiple animal groups simultaneously","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for contagious disease transmission in green spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate wildlife management leading to disease transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of urban matrix on disease transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Green space location influencing restorativeness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Population density around green space affecting safety perception and wildlife richness","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Site-level factors and spatial configuration influencing restorativeness and wildlife support","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of water bodies in green spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trade-offs within animal groups due to grass cover","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Safety perception and dense vegetation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive correlation between urban wildlife support and vegetation structure may lead to increased contact between humans and wildlife, increasing the risk of zoonotic disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of non-native and invasive plant species negatively affecting avian and lepidopteran communities, potentially leading to population decline and loss of biodiversity.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Design features such as water bodies, footpaths alignment, and habitat heterogeneity may impact human behavior and perception, potentially affecting the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Minimizing forest edges and designing trails far from forest patches may reduce wildlife protection and mental health benefits while allowing human immersion in nature.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Intensive vegetation management for mental health benefits may be detrimental to wildlife, leading to an increase in urban exploiter species.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Human aesthetic preferences in green spaces may negatively impact urban wildlife support, leading to a potential conflict between human preferences and wildlife habitat needs.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of dogs in green spaces can disrupt wildlife activity patterns, but walking dogs is a common motivation for people to visit green spaces.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Management of decorative vegetation can impact wildlife support and the restorative potential of green spaces.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive impact of biological sounds and geophysical sounds on restoration, stress recovery, and tranquility perception","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative effect of traffic noise on green spaces and bird communities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent relationship between actual and perceived levels of biodiversity in green spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate management of green spaces may lead to the spread of contagious diseases among humans and animals.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases from wildlife to humans in green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Perception of biodiversity may not be fully correlated to actual biodiversity levels","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of setting characteristics on biodiversity perception","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential correlation between activities and perceived restorativeness and well-being","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlation between connection to nature and perceived biodiversity, and gender with perceived safety","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of green space characteristics on human and animal health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of quality assessment of green areas in studies can lead to inconsistent evidence on the effect of green space on health outcomes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"On-site studies may suffer from drawbacks such as time, funding, control of confounders, and small sample sizes, limiting the reliability of the findings.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Laboratory experiments using visual stimuli and students as participants may not fully represent the reality of user experience in green spaces or the characteristics of the whole population.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of studies on urban green spaces in developing countries","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transferability of empirical evidence from developed to developing countries","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Role of perceived safety in urban green spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to nature in urban areas leading to reduced restoration and well-being","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disturbance, fragmentation, and isolation of urban green spaces impacting wildlife support","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interactions with humans may be detrimental to animals, causing stress responses and changes in population size and distribution.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Indicators of green space quality are influenced by outcomes in bird assemblages, leading to potential bias in wildlife outcome assessments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusion of measures that assess qualitative aspects of community composition is important to distinguish between urban exploiters, alien and invasive species, and native and sensitive species in green spaces.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of interdisciplinary work in addressing human, animal, and environmental factors","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited studies comparing human use and biodiversity conservation in green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focus on the effect of biodiversity on human health rather than considering both dimensions simultaneously","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"}]}
